@graph.caption: These tomatillo poblano white beans are a warm stew of perfectly creamy beans, tomatillos, spicy poblano pepper, onion, cumin, and oregano.

itemListElement.name: Tomatillo Poblano White Beans (The Ultimate Vegan Cookbook for Your Instant Pot)

@graph.headline: Tomatillo Poblano White Beans (The Ultimate Vegan Cookbook for Your Instant Pot)

@graph.name: Dora S.
@graph.description: Dora is the founder, recipe developer, and photographer at Dora's Table and Mi Mero Mole. Born and raised in Mexico and a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America in New York, she adopted a vegan (plant-based) diet to take control of her health.

@graph.name: Tomatillo Poblano White Beans
@graph.description: Instant Pot Poblano White Beans, white beans simmered in a tomatillo poblano salsa.

video.name: Instant Pot Poblano White Beans
video.description: Instant Pot Poblano White Beans, white beans simmered in poblano peppers and tomatillos.

recipeIngredient: 1 cup Chopped poblano (seed and stems removed before chopping)
1/2  Jalapeño, without seeds (or use more to make it hotter)
1 1/2 cups Dried Great Northern beans (soaked for 8-12 hours and drained)

recipeInstructions.text: For the sauté, add the tomatillos, poblano, onion and jalapeño to your blender or food processor. Pulse until the veggies are in tiny pieces, but not pureed.
recipeInstructions.name: For the sauté, add the tomatillos, poblano, onion and jalapeño to your blender or food processor. Pulse until the veggies are in tiny pieces, but not pureed.

recipeInstructions.text: Use the sauté setting over normal, or medium heat, and pour in the blended veggies; add the cumin and stir to combine. Cook for about 4 minutes to remove the edge off the onions and make the cumin more fragrant.
recipeInstructions.name: Use the sauté setting over normal, or medium heat, and pour in the blended veggies; add the cumin and stir to combine. Cook for about 4 minutes to remove the edge off the onions and make the cumin more fragrant.

recipeInstructions.text: For the pressure cooker, add the beans, water and oregano to the sauté mixture and stir to combine. Put the lid on and make sure that the steam release handle is sealed. Cook on manual setting at high pressure and set for 35 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: For the pressure cooker, add the beans, water and oregano to the sauté mixture and stir to combine. Put the lid on and make sure that the steam release handle is sealed. Cook on manual setting at high pressure and set for 35 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Allow the pressure to release naturally.
recipeInstructions.name: Allow the pressure to release naturally.

recipeInstructions.text: If there is still more liquid in the pot than you’d like to have, switch back to the sauté setting and simmer to allow some of the liquid to evaporate.
recipeInstructions.name: If there is still more liquid in the pot than you’d like to have, switch back to the sauté setting and simmer to allow some of the liquid to evaporate.

recipeInstructions.text: Add salt and pepper to taste before serving.
recipeInstructions.name: Add salt and pepper to taste before serving.

@graph.keywords: instant pot, instant pot beans, poblano, pressure cooker beans, tomato poblano white beans, white beans
